name: INDIAN (Native American)
description:
Indian were the first North American settlers to come from Asia more than 20,000 years ago. 
In order to get hunt, they wander through the Bering Strait 
(formerly the isthmus, now separating the easternmost point of the Asian continent 
and the westernmost point of the Americas).  Then they settled and developed into various tribes.  
Over the centuries they built an orderly society. In the 16th century, Europeans arrived in North America for the first time.  
Thinking they arrived in India (Asia), they mistakenly called the natives "Indians".  
Therefore, the natives of the Americas are known as "Indians" as the English word for Indian people.
